introduction_to_problem.description: Botanists face challenges in recognizing a wide variety of flowers with nearly half a million types discovered.
introduction_to_problem.solution_proposed: Information Technology offers machine learning solutions for flower recognition.

rationale_for_study.description: Rose plants have unique features in their leaves which can be used for identification.
rationale_for_study.significance: Rose leaves have a longer lifespan and can preserve identity features longer than flowers.

objective.main_goal: To perform automatic classification of rose plants using machine learning based on leaf features.

methodology.feature_extraction: Histogram and texture features of leaves were utilized.
methodology.data_collection: Dataset composed of images collected using a 23MP camera of various rose species.

machine_learning_models_used.optimization: Random Forest model was optimized by tuning parameters such as number of trees and depth of trees.

comparison_to_deep_learning.comparative_observation: Deep learning models performed poorly against machine learning models due to small dataset size.
